section.name: Tab pages panel
section.span: What and where is the tab pages panel?

div.p: The tab pages panel. Is for content. Call it content panel, file panel, present panel?

section.p: The tab pages panel is for changing and reviewing files (documents, images or assets). The tab pages panel holds one or more tab pages. Each tab page shows a document, image or asset. The tab pages are lying on top of each other, so you can actually see only the upper one. But you can easily switch between them: Each tab page has a tab at its upper edge and tabs of all tab pages are visible at all time. You can click on a tab to put that tab page on top.

The tab pages panel only exists when you have opened at least one file, which will be shown on a tab page. When you close a file, its tab page goes away. If you close the last of the opened files, the tab pages panel also goes away. The region on your screen that was occupied by the tab pages panel may then become empty, show a nice image or show another panel.

ul.li: If you are doing the tour, use the back button of your browser to continue. (There is no hyperlink here, because you can get here from many different pages.)
